head.citation-title: Uncertainty principles associated with quaternionic linear canonical transforms
head.abstracts: Copyright © 2016 John Wiley & Sons, Ltd.In the present paper, we generalize the linear canonical transform (LCT) to quaternion-valued signals, known as the quaternionic LCT (QLCT). Using the properties of the LCT, we establish an uncertainty principle for the two-sided QLCT. This uncertainty principle prescribes a lower bound on the product of the effective widths of quaternion-valued signals in the spatial and frequency domains. It is shown that only a Gaussian quaternionic signal minimizes the uncertainty. Copyright © 2016 John Wiley & Sons, Ltd.

translated-sourcetitle.$: Mathematical Methods in the Applied Sciences

source.sourcetitle: Mathematical Methods in the Applied Sciences

grant-text.$: The first author acknowledges the financial support from the National Natural Science Foundation of China for Young Scholars (no. 11401606), the University of Macau nos. The third author acknowledges the financial support from the Asociación Mexicana de Cultura, AC.
